author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Department of Revenue and Disaster Management, Special Secretary and Puducherry District Collector S. Sundaravadivelu has said that even small-sized display boards relating to political parties or association name boards connecting to any political parties kept in public places should be removed immediately.

In view of forthcoming elections, the Special Secretary last week ordered that all wall posters, paintings, digital banners, cut-outs, and hoardings in public places should be removed by Saturday.

He had also asked the individuals and political parties to remove such materials voluntarily and said or otherwise such materials would be removed.

Another notification

Issuing yet another notification, he said, “The people who put up small-sized display boards relating to political parties or association name boards which connected to any political parties should come forward to remove themselves immediately from public places.”

“If they fail to do so immediately, government authorities will remove them and collect the cost from the political parties or organisations concerned. Criminal action will be initiated against those who break the order,” said Mr. Sundaravadivelu.
title: Remove even small-sized publicity materials: Collector
